bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 162, Number 179 (Monday, December 12, 2016)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. FINCHER:H.R. 6527.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:This legislation creates incentives for states andlocalities to share DUI conviction information througheffective reporting. Specific authority is provided byArticle I, section 8 of the United States Constitution, whichgrants Congress the power to provide for the general Welfareof the United States.[Page H7577]

item.name: Crime and Federal Government Surveillance Subcommittee
Crime and Federal Government Surveillance Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, Homeland Security, and Investigations.
Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E1710)

summary.text:
States Against Drunk Driving Act of 2016 or the SADD Act of 2016

This bill authorizes supplemental funds under the Edward Byrne Memorial Justice Assistance Grant program for states that: (1) report at least 90% of DUI convictions, and (2) have in effect a law or policy that requires a DUI conviction to be taken into account for purposes of an enhanced criminal sentence under state law.

The term "DUI conviction" means a criminal conviction for operating a motor vehicle under the influence of a drug or alcohol.

bill.title: SADD Act of 2016

item.title: To provide for a supplemental award of funds under the Byrne JAG program to States that report DUI convictions to the Attorney General, and for other purposes.
States Against Drunk Driving Act of 2016

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, Homeland Security, and Investigations.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
